title: Which European country has the fastest internet? - Quora

response.answer_text: Europe has the world’s highest concentration of countries with the fastest internet. Jersey is Europe’s fastest jurisdiction, offering an average speed of 67.46Mbps. Sweden is Europe’s fastest country with an average speed of 55.18Mbps. Denmark (5) and Luxembourg (7) are not far behind with average speeds of 43.99 and 40.12Mbps respectively. Of the 54 territories measured in Europe, only Turkey (102) and Armenia (110) are outside the top 100. NOTE: 37 of the 50 countries with the fastest internet are located in Europe SOURCE: Countries with the fastest internet in the world 2019 | Atlas & Boots

Its very difficult to say without more precision in how you want to define “has the fastest internet”. Lithuania and Latvia would probably be near the top of list of EU countries overall with Vilnius and Riga near the top. Both have extremely good internet. Again without more detail on how precisely you want to define things there are oddly likely some towns/small cities with far better as the data center outside of a city is there etc etc. The Baltics are however quite good.
